newsitem.title: USA: Applied Imaging files medical device forms.
newsitem.headline: Applied Imaging files medical device forms.

text.p: Applied Imaging Corp said Wednesday that it submitted two 510(k) medical device applications to the United States Food and Drug Administration on December 31.

The first submission is for a product that enriches the concentration of any one of a number of cell types from whole blood, including fetal nucleated red blood cells, nucleated red blood cells, and white blood cell types. The product is based on the company's patented hematological techniques.

The second submission is for an automated image analysis instrument, which is a general laboratory tool, able to automatically detect and locate any of a number of cell types on a microscope slide. The instrument presents these cells for operator review, further treatment, and eventual use in a diagnostic or screening procedure.
